main event: On 3 September 1957 in Yuma, Arizona, there was a sighting of an elongated aerial object with ragged edges, brown in the middle, about one foot long, which passed at about 30 degrees azimuth to the observers and then disappeared from sight after 7 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as elongated with ragged edges and brown in the middle, resembling a meteor or meteor-like phenomena.
The observation lasted for 7 minutes, providing a detailed account of the sighting.
There were no photographs present in the report, indicating a lack of visual evidence.
The sighting was also observed by the duty director and involved other target aircraft in the area, suggesting a detailed investigation.
The report was part of Project Blue Book, a United States Air Force project that investigated UFOs, indicating official interest and investigation into the incident.
result: The sighting was believed to be that of a Meteor or Meteor-like phenomena.
sighted object: An elongated aerial object with ragged edges, brown in the middle, about one foot long
witnesses: Duty director 1/Lt Edward J. Repen, 4759th AM DEF SQDN, along with other observers
photographs: No photographs present in the report
